content: **the freedom collection - hat** the freedom collection came to fruition purely as a way of using up all those scrappy bits of yarn that were abandoned in the bottom of my project bag freeing them from the shadows and turning them into something beautiful this pattern will instruct you on how to knit a simple but striking colourwork hat using all those leftover bits of dk yarn and as it s knit with yarn you already have stashed away it s essentially a free project the freedom collection is currently made up of three patterns a cowl hat and wrist warmers i will strive to make most of the patterns within this collection free of charge and those that do have a price will be on a chose what you pay pricing model with discount codes available to assist with financial accessibility **construction** knit bottom up in the round using a two-stranded colourwork knitting technique with a ribbed brim and a simple k2tog decreased crown **sizes** newborn baby toddler child adult s adult m adult l **yarn** dk in multiple colours mc children sizes approx 25g adult sizes approx 30g cc children sizes 3g per colour block stripe approx 27g adult sizes 4g per colour block stripe approx 48g nb - approx yarn weights given for largest child/adult sizes samples made in toft dk shale for the mc and a selection of toft dk yarns for the ccs **yardage** child sample total yardage 93m/102yds weight 42g adult m sample total yardage 121m/132yds weight 55g if you fancy knitting this hat longer than given measurements please allow for this in your yarn requirements **needles** 3 5mm and 4 mm/ size 4 and size 6 40cm for newborn to child sizes 60cm for adult sizes circular needles or needles to obtain gauge use magic loop or dpns for crown if preferred **gauge** 23 sts x 25 rounds = 10x10cm / 4x4 inches in charted stockinette stitch in the round blocked **measurements** approx 36 40 44 48 51 56 58 cm 14 16 17 5 19 20 21 5 23 **notions** tapestry needle 1 stitch marker scissors pompom optional digital weighing scales **skills used** cast on ribbing stranded colourwork thank you so much for viewing my ravelry page and for supporting me - it means so much find me on instagram @houseofbuddleia check out the hashtag #hobfreedomcollection and #hobfreedomhat on instagram full disclosure why are these patterns free the patterns of the freedom collection have not been though a test knitting process other than me making the samples i don t have the funds for a tech editor right now and giving full details of yarn weights and yardages in a scrappy project is really difficult plus i wanted people to see my pattern writing style as i m new to this i can totally understand people not wanting to spend their hard earned money on my patterns without knowing anything about my writing style so hopefully these freebies will give you
